ca.mcgill.ecse211.model

Class Odometer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.model.OdometerData
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.model.Odometer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Odometer
extends OdometerData
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class deals with keeping track of the robot's position (i.e., the odometer) It extends the OdometerData class and implements the Runnable interface
    Author:
    Carlo D'Angelo, Mohamed Samee

        Constant Field Values

      • ODOMETER_SLEEP_AMOUNT

        private static final long ODOMETER_SLEEP_AMOUNT
        Before any of the navigation methods are called, the odometer thread will sleep this amount (in milliseconds). In doing so, threads issues between the motor threads and the odometer thread are prevented.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • Odometer

                 EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
                 double TRACK,
                 double WHEEL_RAD)
          throws OdometerExceptions
        This is the default constructor of this class. It initiates all motors and variables once.It cannot be accessed externally.

                                   EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
                                   double TRACK,
                                   double WHEEL_RAD)
                            throws OdometerExceptions
        This method is meant to ensure only one instance of the odometer is used throughout the code.

        Returns:
        new or existing Odometer Object

      • getOdometer

        public static Odometer getOdometer()
                            throws OdometerExceptions
        This class is meant to return the existing Odometer Object. It is meant to be used only if an odometer object has been created
        Returns:
        error if no previous odometer exists
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions
